note: VERIFIED CORRECT. The identity log(1_A ⊗ rho_B) = 1_A ⊗ log(rho_B) is mathematically valid. Proof sketch: If rho_B = sum_j mu_j |f_j><f_j| and {|e_i>} is an ONB for H_A, then 1_A ⊗ rho_B = sum_{i,j} mu_j |e_i><e_i| ⊗ |f_j><f_j|, so log(1_A ⊗ rho_B) = sum_{i,j} log(mu_j) |e_i><e_i| ⊗ |f_j><f_j| = 1_A ⊗ log(rho_B). Positivity of rho_B (needed for log to be defined) is guaranteed by the full-rank assumption in node 1.1. A minor nomenclature note was filed: the result is more precisely "functional calculus commutes with *-homomorphisms" rather than "spectral mapping theorem," but the mathematical content is unaffected.
